articles.headline: How Some Would Level the Playing Field: Free Harvard Degrees
articles.snippet: The slate of five running for the Board of Overseers, which helps set strategy for the university, was put together by a conservative advocate from California.
articles.abstract: The slate of five running for the Board of Overseers, which helps set strategy for the university, was put together by a conservative advocate from California.

articles.headline: Foursquare Raises $45 Million, Cutting Its Valuation Nearly in Half
articles.snippet: The company, which is also shaking up its executive ranks, is focused on its data-based advertising and developer businesses.
articles.abstract: The company, which is also shaking up its executive ranks, is focused on its data-based advertising and developer businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Dennis Crowley helped found Foursquare in 2009, he was ahead of the pack in creating a social app that used location technology. Now Foursquare may be at the front of another coming wave: tech start-ups that are raising money at lower valuations than before.

articles.headline: Chipotle’s New Mantra: Safe Food, Not Just Fresh
articles.snippet: An E. coli outbreak has been a particularly hard blow for a popular chain that has based its reputation on fresh food.
articles.abstract: An E. coli outbreak has been a particularly hard blow for a popular chain that has based its reputation on fresh food.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not many business success stories rival Chipotle Mexican Grill’s.

articles.headline: Goldman to Pay Up to $5 Billion to Settle Claims of Faulty Mortgages
articles.snippet: Goldman Sachs is among the last big Wall Street banks to settle claims for selling flawed mortgage securities.
articles.abstract: Goldman Sachs is among the last big Wall Street banks to settle claims for selling flawed mortgage securities.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than seven years after the worst of the financial crisis, Goldman Sachs is again paying a price for the role it played.

articles.headline: In Taiwan, Survivor Mentality Stymies Tech Innovation
articles.snippet: As voters chose a new president over the weekend, a rare point of agreement between Taiwan’s fractious political parties was that the tech industry needs help.
articles.abstract: As voters chose a new president over the weekend, a rare point of agreement between Taiwan’s fractious political parties was that the tech industry needs help.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAIPEI, Taiwan — With its offices sporting wood flooring, a roof painted bright orange and conference rooms named after target markets in Southeast Asia, AppWorks, one of Taiwan’s few start-up accelerators, has the look and feel of the American counterparts it’s modeled on.

articles.headline: Morgan Stanley Heeds Its Investors
articles.snippet: After long holding off on a big overhaul, Morgan Stanley is cutting hundreds of jobs on its troubled bond and commodity trading desks.
articles.abstract: After long holding off on a big overhaul, Morgan Stanley is cutting hundreds of jobs on its troubled bond and commodity trading desks.
articles.lead_paragraph: In recent years, meetings between James P. Gorman, Morgan Stanley’s chief executive, and the bank’s investors often came back to the same question: When was Mr. Gorman going to do more to deal with the bank’s most problematic business — its bond and commodity trading desks.

articles.headline: As Germany Welcomes Migrants, Sexual Attacks in Cologne Point to a New Reality
articles.snippet: Before the violent assaults on women in Cologne on New Year’s Eve, the police thought their biggest worry would be pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds.
articles.abstract: Before the violent assaults on women in Cologne on New Year’s Eve, the police thought their biggest worry would be pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLOGNE, Germany — In early December, the Cologne police made their New Year’s Eve preparations. Drawing on the previous year’s experience, they identified their biggest worry as pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds. So they increased their holiday deployment, to 142 from 88, concentrating on the banks of the Rhine River, where revelers traditionally gather for a giant fireworks display.

articles.headline: Investigation of SEAL Conduct in Afghanistan Is Reopened
articles.snippet: The N.C.I.S. has begun further inquiry into allegations that Navy SEALs and Afghan police militiamen beat several detainees, including one who died, at an isolated outpost in 2012.
articles.abstract: The N.C.I.S. has begun further inquiry into allegations that Navy SEALs and Afghan police militiamen beat several detainees, including one who died, at an isolated outpost in 2012.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Naval Criminal Investigative Service has reopened its investigation into allegations that Navy SEALs and Afghan police militiamen beat several detainees, including one who died, at an isolated outpost in Afghanistan in 2012, agency officials said Thursday.

articles.headline: At Republican Debate, Taunts and Quips as Rivals Battle
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas shed months of cordiality as the latest presidential debate became a hand-to-hand fight in their razor-close contest in the Iowa caucuses.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas shed months of cordiality as the latest presidential debate became a hand-to-hand fight in their razor-close contest in the Iowa caucuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. — Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas sharply attacked each other on Thursday night over the Canadian-born Mr. Cruz’s eligibility to be president and Mr. Trump’s “New York values,” shedding any semblance of cordiality as they dominated a Republican debate less than three weeks before the Iowa caucuses.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: Walmart to Close 269 Stores as Retailers Struggle
articles.snippet: The giant retailer said about 16,000 employees would be affected by the move.
articles.abstract: The giant retailer said about 16,000 employees would be affected by the move.
articles.lead_paragraph: Walmart, whose supercenters once transformed the way Americans shop, announced on Friday that it would close a record number of stores in the United States and overseas, as it fights to hold its ground in a retail landscape under siege by the behemoth Amazon.
